action.action-desc: Mr. Stivers (for himself, Ms. Michelle Lujan Grisham of New Mexico, Mrs. Blackburn, Ms. Pingree, Mrs. Comstock, Mr. Collins of New York, Mr. Kilmer, Mr. Pearce, Mr. Tiberi, Mr. DeFazio, Ms. Sinema, and Mrs. Bustos) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide the opportunity for responsible health savings to all American families.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Responsible Additions and Increases to Sustain Employee Health Benefits Act of 2017.

paragraph.text: Paragraph (1) of section 125(i) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking $2,500 and inserting $5,000, with an additional $500 per each additional employee dependent above two dependents, and

by inserting at the end the following: An additional employee dependent may not be taken into account under the preceding sentence for any taxable year if such additional employee dependent has been taken into account by another person under such sentence for such taxable year..

paragraph.text: Paragraph (2) of section 125(i) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking December 31, 2013 and inserting December 31, 2017,
by striking the dollar amount and inserting each of the dollar amounts, and
in subparagraph (B), by striking calendar year 2012 and inserting calendar year 2016.

subsection.text: Section 125(i) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

subparagraph.text: A plan or arrangement may permit a participant in a health flexible spending arrangement to elect to carry forward any aggregate unused balances in the participant’s accounts under such arrangement as of the close of any year to the succeeding year. Such carryforward shall be treated as having occurred within 30 days of the close of the year.
The amount which a participant may elect to carry forward under subparagraph (A) from any year shall be any aggregate unused balances in the participant’s account at the close of any year.
No amount shall be included in gross income under this chapter by reason of any carryforward under this paragraph.

The maximum amount which may be contributed to a health flexible spending arrangement for any year to which an unused amount is carried under this paragraph shall not be reduced by such unused amount.

subsection.text: Section 125(i) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking Limitation on flexible spending arrangements in the heading and inserting Special rules for health flexible spending arrangements.
The amendments made by this section shall take effect on the date of the enactment of this Act.
